content:
That's a great idea! Using extra peanut butter as a substitute for coconut oil is a brilliant way to repurpose the leftover peanut butter and add more nutty flavor to your No-Bake Energy Granola Bars.

Peanut butter is a great binding agent, and it will help hold the mixture together nicely. Since you're using a similar consistency ingredient, you can substitute the coconut oil with an equal amount of peanut butter (1/4 cup).

Keep in mind that using more peanut butter will:

* Add more calories and fat to the bars
* Make the bars slightly more dense and chewy
* Intensify the peanut butter flavor (which is a great thing if you love peanut butter, like you do!)

To ensure the bars hold together well, make sure to:

* Mix the ingredients thoroughly to distribute the peanut butter evenly
* Press the mixture into the baking dish firmly to get a compact bar
* Refrigerate the bars for at least 30 minutes to set before cutting

I think the extra peanut butter will work beautifully in the recipe, and you'll end up with deliciously chewy and flavorful granola bars. Enjoy!
